entry.title: Re: Master data mass maintenance in SAP S/4HANA Public cloud.
entry.content:
Hi @boon_samal ,

Some fields have not been enabled for mass updates—so even if they are visible in the export templates, they are still not available in the mass maintenance application. However, you can still use the old product mass maintenance application.

entry.title: Re: Rework return to first activity in routing
entry.content:
'too many entry steps' error is caused by linking your TAKEOUT operation 30 to ST010 operation 10, if you remove/skip that link you should be able to save it.

I don´t have as much details as I would need to understand your current implementation, but to fulfill your requirements of moving WIP SFCs from the production line to a buffer, I would definitely use a Special Operation Activity and the process described at https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-digital-manufacturing/execution/pulling-sfc-into-special-operation-activity and showed in detail in my blog https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-blog-posts-by-sap/bring-done-sfcs-back-to-work/ba-p/13923872, but for a slightly different context, so you would need to adapt.

This would allow you to move WIP SFCs to a buffer Special Operation in a different Resource, and later on return it to any activity. I just gave it a try, see details below.

Create a Special Operation: BUFFER

Which creates a Special Routing BUFFER automatically, just edit it and add Return and select 'Return to Any Activity'

Take an Active SFC at Resource Z_ASM1

User A Manoel moves it to BUFFER by Starting it at Special Operation BUFFER and a different Resource

User B CTIMES completes the Special Operation, taking SFC out of the BUFFER and returning it to any operation

Hope it helps, Manoel

entry.title: Re: SAC Story - Dropdown for property of Date dimension.
entry.content:
@antonclv19 

I am not sure of your exact requirement but it seems you want to create a dropdown with Year month values like 202501.....202512 and then based on drop down selection you want to filter the table.

Create 3 Script variable of type string as below. DD_Month and DD_Year , set them array

Now create 2 dropdowns, one for year and other for CALMONTH. So if you select 2025 in Year the other dropdown will show 202501 to 202512 and if you select 2026 it will show 202601 to 202612.

Keep the setting as below

// Define the year and the number of months.
var year =Sel_Year ;
var totalMonths = 12;

// Initialize DD_Month variable with an empty array.
 DD_Month = [''];

// Loop through each month from 1 to 12.
for (var month = 1; month <= totalMonths; month++) {
  // Pad the month number with a leading zero if it's a single digit.
  // This ensures the format is always MM (e.g., 01, 02, ..., 12).
  if(month<10)
	  {
		var yearMonthString = Sel_Year+"0"+month.toString();
	  }
else
			  {
				yearMonthString = Sel_Year+month.toString();  
			  }
			  
    

  // Convert the string to a number and push it into the DD_Month array.
  DD_Month.push(yearMonthString);
}

Since your calmonth drop down is bind to DD_Month it will show the values in that array variable a shown below. Now you can use the dropdown the way you need.

 

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Can Joule AI Make SAP Readiness Check & Process Insights Smarter?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m Tommy, an intern at SAP. As part of my internship, I’ve been given the research topic:

                  "How to utilise Joule to interpret SAP tools such as Readiness Check and Signavio Process Insights"

After discussions with the original topic proposer, I’ve refined this to:

                    "Leveraging Joule AI for immediate, context-aware interpretation of SAP tools such as Readiness Check and Process                                  Insights outputs through integrated or standalone models."

Current ideas under exploration:

Potential role of AI (Joule):

                     Integrated approach – Joule embedded directly in tools for live Q&A and guidance.

                     Standalone approach – Central Joule portal where exported tool data is uploaded for AI-generated summaries.

Industry & process-specific insights:

                     Could Joule be trained using Signavio Process Explorer as a knowledge source?

Customer-specific process learning:

                     Could Joule learn a customer’s business processes over time to adjust tool benchmark thresholds?

                     For example, if a process is flagged as problematic by a benchmark but is actually fine for a specific customer, could                                 Joule adapt to avoid false alarms?

I’m not looking to start a conversation and see if this direction aligns with others’ perspectives and see if anyone has experience in the topic.

Would love to hear your thoughts!

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Print Manager (CPM) and SAP RISE
entry.content:
Hi @ADO 

Your interpretation is mostly correct regarding SAP Cloud Print Manager usage with RISE. The SAP note 3420465 describes differences and setups for CPM between cloud and on-premise SAP S/4HANA systems, and the document outlines how CPM can also be enabled in on-premise environments from 2024 onward.

Regarding your question about multiple locations, yes It is possible to install a separate CPM instance at each physical location where you have printers. These multiple CPM instances can connect to a single RISE system, enabling distributed printing management tailored to each site's local printers. This distributed CPM deployment approach is recommended to handle location-specific printer access and networking efficiently.

In summary, you can have 1-to-n CPMs connected to a single RISE system, each handling their local print infrastructure. This provides flexibility for multi-site organizations like yours.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Issue with Form Language in Billing Document Output I...
entry.content:
Hello @Ayman101 ,

From the screenshot, your OPD–Form Template step has Form Language set to FR (French) for both entries. That means the language setting itself is correct, but if your output still appears in Spanish, the likely issue is below,

  • The determination step isn’t being triggered for the billing document in question.
  • Another OPD condition of higher priority might be triggered first.
  • Or the Bill-to Party language is becoming dominant because no matching OPD rule is found for the actual document key fields such as Sales Org, Document Type, and Country.

Recommended next step to confirm:

  • In Maintain Output Parameter Determination, use the simulation/test function for the billing document number.
  • This will show exactly which OPD rule is being applied and whether it’s your French one.

Video Tutorial: How to Configure Output Parameter Determination for Billing Documents

Outgoing Payment Advices: FAQ 

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Description information for Signavio synchronized sol...
entry.content:
Hi @ThomasMetzger 

Please note that in SAP Cloud ALM, the "Description" field under Solution Process Flow for processes synchronized from Signavio will only display text if the corresponding description is maintained in Signavio before synchronization.

To ensure this works, I suggest you consider the following:

  • Log-on and open the relevant process model in Signavio.
  • Then proceed to enter the desired text in the Description property of the process or the relevant BPMN element.
  • Ensure to save the model and synchronize it with SAP Cloud ALM.

If no description is maintained in Signavio, Cloud ALM will show “No description is defined.” after synchronization.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Missing Create external document(URL) button in GOS o...
entry.content:
Hello @nagao_masahiro_ 

In SAP S/4HANA Public cloud, the Create external document (URL) GOS option from on-premises is not included and cannot be activated. Public Cloud only provides approved GOS functions like Create Attachment and Create Note due to security and governance restrictions.

There is no SGOS customising in Public Cloud, so external URLs must be managed through permitted attachment methods or SAP Document Management Service.

SAP Help Portal – Attachments in S/4HANA Cloud

Third-Party Repository Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud

2787596 - Generic Object Services (GOS) functionality and EAM Fiori / Web Dynpro Apps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: VAT number is not populating in the invoice VBRK-STCEG
entry.content:
Hello @aravindrawat 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, rule D in VAT registration number determination uses the VAT number from the Sold-to Party.

Your VAT is only registered at the Ship-to Party, so VBRK-STCEG remains blank.
To resolve this, either:

  • Add the VAT number to the Sold-to Party BP, or change the determination rule to use the Ship-to Party.

SAP Help Portal – VAT Registration Number Determination in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Let me know if you need further assistance

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Latency Issue between Update/Create Entity & Get Enti...
entry.content:
Hi @DonnaA 

Thank you for your message.

Regarding the issue with outdated plant PID values after Update/Create Entity calls in our multiple application server environment, the root cause is likely session inconsistency between calls, especially under high traffic. MDK doesn’t have a built‑in way to force subsequent calls to use the same server session, but here are some recommended approaches:

First, configure session stickiness or affinity on the load balancer so sequential calls from the same session go to the same app server.

Then continue using BYPASSING BUFFER or similar cache bypass methods to ensure fresh reads.

Thereafter you can trigger the offline data download only after the backend transaction is fully committed and visible in the database.

Ensure to manage caching and buffering carefully at all layers.

Finally, optimize the offline store sync process and include checks to confirm the data reflects the latest updates before download.

These steps can help prevent having to rely on repeated retries while ensuring your data refresh reflects the correct, current values.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Signavio Single Sign-On Functions
entry.content:
Hi @Navigator1 

Thank you for your question

Based on the information you provided, here is the clarification on your questions regarding SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub with SSO:

Regarding License Assignment via SSO

  • Licenses are not automatically assigned just by accessing via SSO. They must be assigned in Signavio’s user management.
  • Licenses are per user or session and are released when the user logs off.
  • A single license cannot be used for multiple simultaneous sessions.

Regarding Access Profile Control with SAML/SSO

  • Users must be created or provisioned in Signavio and given roles or privileges. SSO will not automatically assign “Viewer HUB only” or other roles.
  • For additional modules such as Process Manager, Process Intelligence, etc., user access and privileges must be manually updated in each module.

To summarize, SSO authenticates users but does not automate license assignment or role provisioning. All access rights and licenses need to be managed explicitly in the platform’s user administration.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Web Dynpro adaptions - Tier 1 or Tier 3
entry.content:
Hi @RajendraP 

In general, changes to Web Dynpro application code are considered Tier 3 changes.

To evaluate your specific case:

Adding a field using Component Configuration (purely configuration, no coding) is classified as Tier 1 adaptation.

Any modifications involving coding or extending the Web Dynpro component logic would fall under Tier 3.

Summary:

Code changes --> Tier 3

Configuration via Component Configuration --> Tier 1 adaptation

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.content:
Hello @rekafulop 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the FSV 1799 from the J58 script isn’t always provided. If it’s absent in Manage Global Hierarchies, any rule referencing nodes like 1799/038 will fail. You must either import it from delivered content (if available) or create it manually and map your G/L accounts before the validation rule can function. Let me know if you need further support.

Chuma

entry.title: Re: New Features and Fixes: Share Buttons, Notifications Feed, and More
entry.content:
@Jelena_PerfiljevaI was honestly afraid of getting this kind of answer.

Regardless of the reasons, my intention here is not to debate political arguments. I’m sure there are political factors involved, and I could list reasons why X is still relevant, along with examples of Elon Musk’s actions that have benefited its users.

However, I will assume that the addition of "Bluesky sharing" was not simply intended as a corporate sanction against X or Elon Musk.

Let’s focus on the feedback linked in the announcement. It doesn’t seem like anyone explicitly asked for “Bluesky.” In fact, the suggestion mentioned “LinkedIn or X.”

 

Personally, the share button is just a convenience. I’ve lost count of how many times I copied a link from my browser and shared it elsewhere (like WhatsApp) simply because it was easier. I might use it more often if it allowed sharing to multiple platforms.

On WordPress (which, as far as I know, is no longer the content management system for SAP Community), adding a share button with configurable options for different social networks is straightforward.

Facebook, X, LinkedIn, YouTube, WhatsApp, Instagram, TikTok, Telegram, Bluesky, Reddit, Slack, Discord—just to name some popular platforms in Europe and the Americas. I’m sure there are many other relevant ones in Asia.

So why not add them all and let users decide where they want to share SAP content? If some aren’t being used, they can be removed later.

If there are strong reasons for avoiding X, I would expect SAP to make that position clear—perhaps by shutting down the SAP Community profile there (which has over 100,000 followers compared to only 432 on Bluesky).

Again, I have nothing against Bluesky, but the SAP Community presence there is clearly minimal in numbers. I’d bet there’s more SAP-related content being shared on Reddit—probably even more than on SAP Community itself. 

Meanwhile, the low-quality SAP content I often see on LinkedIn (including posts from some recently nominated SAP Champions) should be far more concerning to SAP than any actions by Elon Musk. Of course, this is just my opinion, and I’m not trying to start another debate. Still, everyone knows LinkedIn belongs to one of SAP’s most important partners—Microsoft—and the poor SAP content on LinkedIn is certainly not Microsoft’s fault.

entry.title: Re: Master Data Integration - Cloud Foundry Runtime / Spa...
entry.content:
Hi @JaySchwendemann 

In SAP Master Data Integration, the naming convention for service instances can vary by scenario. The scenarios determine the integration success.

For the General “vanilla” guidance: No spaces in instance names, runtime “other.”

For a Scenario-specific guidance e.g., Digital Manufacturing or Business Process Orchestration, it may require or recommend using spaces in instance names.

If you start with instances without spaces, you can still onboard BPO later by creating additional instances with spaces as required. This won’t impact any other earlier deployments you may have carried out.

I recommend you follow the naming convention for your current scenario but be aware of future needs and plan accordingly to ensure smooth integration.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Create a Master Data Integration Instance

Naming Conventions

Configuring the SAP Master Data Integration Service Instance in SAP Ariba Solutions

entry.title: Re: How to find the segment i need to map in IDOC if I ha...
entry.content:
Hi @dineshhome1361_7 

If you know you need to map a specific field such as Estimated Arrival Date, I suggest you follow correct IDOC segment that describes the steps. Here are my recommendations:

  • First, ensure you identify the relevant IDOC type for your business process.
  • Then use WE60 IDOC documentation to review the IDOC structure and segments, or WE31 to view detailed segment field lists.
  • Furthermore, check functional specs or process documentation to see which segment holds date-related fields for example E1EDK14/E1EDT14 for deliveries.
  • Follow that up by reviewing test or sample IDOCs in WE19 to confirm the actual field location.
  • Finally, make sure to map the source field to that identified segment and field in your integration.

These steps will help ensure you map the field to the correct segment within the IDOC structure.

 

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Customizing Extraction Fields in SAP Document Information Extraction (DOX)
entry.content:
Hello, 

I’m currently evaluating SAP Document Information Extraction (DOX) in SAP Document AI using a trial account. Although I’ve noticed that it extracts every text very accurately, not every text is being mapped to the extraction fields.
 
I wanted to add/customize header fields myself to map the extracted text to header fields or line items better (while following this link https://help.sap.com/docs/document-ai/sap-document-ai/add-data-fields to add data fields) but schema configuration doesn’t appear in my trial environment. It also states that I cannot change SAP schemas as shown in the attached image below:

So I was wondering if it's possible to edit/customize extraction fields in the premium version of SAP Document AI? If so, does this customization occur before the optical character recognition (OCR) to guide the model, or only after OCR to map extracted text to fields?
 
Defining custom field mappings before OCR would be extremely valuable for my team's use case, so I’d greatly appreciate if anyone can explain what’s possible before I consider upgrading to a full subscription. Thank you.

entry.title: Re: Missing Migration Objects in Treasury – Any Solutions...
entry.content:
Hello @Robert136 

Thank you for your question

The available migration objects in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (release 2508) are limited by the standard Migration Cockpit, which currently offers only a limited set of predefined objects for Treasury & Risk Management.

The following objects are not included as standard migration templates,

  • Business Partner – Counterparty role
  • Loan Facility
  • Loan-to-Facility Assignment
  • Investments

Since these objects are not part of the SAP-provided migration content, they cannot be imported using the standard migration templates in S4HANA Public Cloud. SAP’s current Roadmap Explorer and Cloud Feature Delivery (CFD) do not list them for upcoming releases.

Recommended Approach:

  1. Use Existing Migration Objects Where Possible;-Migrate the core Business Partner records and add roles where necessary
  2. Leverage Released APIs:-For supported entities, utilise OData APIs from SAP API Business Hub to load data programmatically.
  3. Automation for Non-API Scenarios:-For entities without APIs, utilise SAP Build Process Automation or similar RPA tools to simulate mass creation.

It is advisable to split the migration into these workstreams to minimise manual input and accelerate processing, especially considering the volume of records involved.

Let me know if it works

Kind regards,
Chuma

Check below SAP

References:

  • SAP API Business Hub – Treasury APIs
  • SAP Help Portal – Data Migration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Re: Crystal Report - design question since can't have sub...
entry.content:
Hi @MMock 

To properly display your data hierarchy. I recommend you consider the following approach:

The first thing is to keep your main report focused on Systems.

Then make sure to save the Sites subreport as an external report and place it inside a repeating section or group on your main report so it runs once per System, showing all Sites.

Thereafter, ensure that inside the Sites subreport, you insert another subreport to list all contacts for the current Site dynamically. Place this in a section that repeats per Site record.

Then link the reports appropriately as main report → Sites subreport by System ID, and Sites subreport → Contacts subreport by Site ID.

Make sure to avoid putting the Sites subreport in the main report footer as it only runs once per report and will not repeat per System or Site.

Finally, please note, this design enables 1:n nesting and dynamic display of variable numbers of Contacts per Site.

This suggested structure will allow you to display each Site with its associated contacts under the Sites heading correctly.

I hope this provides the necessary guidance. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Change flag in partner profile
entry.content:
Hello @nairharsha 

Thank you for your enquiry regarding the change flag and partner profile settings for outbound integrations in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Please note the following key points,

Partner Profile Management (WE20)

  • In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, classic ECC transactions such as WE20 (partner profile maintenance) are not available. Instead, all integrations, including partner communication settings and output triggers, are handled through Fiori applications and pre-configured communication scenarios.

Change Flag for IDoc Output

  • The concept of enabling/disabling a change flag for message types, as in ECC, does not exist in the public cloud version. Output for document creation and change events is controlled entirely through Output Management Fiori-based and supported integration scenarios from SAP.

Customisation Limitations

    • No ABAP user exits or BADIs can be implemented to adjust output logic or change detection.
    • You can only influence triggers via the standard configuration options available in the system for your scope item or process.

Integration Options

    • Communication arrangements and systems are set up via Fiori apps, such as Maintain Communication Users/Systems/Arrangements.
    • Many outbound processes use APIs (SOAP/REST) instead of classic IDocs.
    • If a specific change scenario (sales quotation change) is not supported in the delivered scope, it cannot be enabled through custom code. In such cases, an enhancement request to SAP or an integration via available APIs may be required.

It is recommended to review the available Output Parameter Determination rules in your system and check the SAP API Business Hub for supported change events related to Sales Quotations.

If your required change event is not covered, please consider submitting an SAP enhancement request or exploring API-based integration options through SAP Business Technology Platform.

Configuring SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Business Partner Attributes

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: How to get visible rows count in SAP Webgui grid view in SAP Build ProcessAutomation task automation
entry.content:

I am building a task automation where bot has to assign settlement rule for each service order item in 'Manage Settlement Rule - Service Documents' app in S/4HANA Public Cloud. 

This is a Webgui screen and I can't find any suitable activity that may provide the visible rows count as it is available in SAP GUI irpa SDK.

I also checked this blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-intelligent-robotic-process-automation-2-0-sap-gui-table-control-2-2/ba-p/13507394 where it mentions about 'Get Scroll Max (GUI Table)' for a SAP GUI table control. But I couldn't find any equivalent activity corresponding to Webgui grid view. 

I understand that for grid view I have to use activity 'Scroll Vertically (WebGUI Grid View)' to allow the bot scroll down to make new rows visible based on the number of service order items. But I need to know how many rows are visible or how many max rows possible to determine when and how many times bot has to scroll down till all the items are worked upon.

@peterengel 

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: Positioning SAP Customer Experience Solutions - Certification and Learning Journey
entry.content:
Hello,

We are pleased to present to you a brand new  SAP CX Certification and learning journey (LJ) aimed at developing your expertise in positioning the SAP CX solutions.

In this LJ, you will find consumable information in form of individual courses which talk about:

  •  How SAP Customer Experience Solutions provide end-to-end solutions that address key priorities of CROs(Free to all)
  • How to position SAP Customer Experience solutions within the SAP Business Suite context(Free for all)
  • The role of SAP Business AI in cloud transformation, its adoption in SAP CX solutions(Free for all)
  • How the elements of a good executive pitch  help you to define and deliver your own successful pitches (Gated course. S-user subscription needed)

In addition, we are thrilled to announce that we have included Practical Exercise with details steps (ILS script) and a hands on system to try them on.

Once you are confident and comfortable trying our the various exercises on the system, we also have a Saleo Based Practical Test which is a walkthrough based test where you will be expected to perform certain workflows. Eg : Task 1 : Develop Sales Forecast.

To be able to successfully complete the practical test, we highly recommend doing the practical exercises.

Please Note: 

  • Practical Test is a subset of  the ILS (Interactive Learning Script) /Practical exercises. Meaning you will find additional steps in the ILS  which will not be there in the Practical Test. The Practical test entails the most important phases of the overall Sales Cycle.
  • For accessing Hands On system under Practical Exercise you will need an S-User Subscription
  • Passing the un-proctored Saleo Practical test is a pre-req to be able to schedule your certification.
  • The Practical test must be taken in one sitting. Progress cannot be saved and resumed later on

Here is the link to the LJ : Positioning SAP Customer Experience Solutions 

We hope you enjoy this LJ and develop your expertise on how to position and sell SAP CX solutions.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: Difference between Replication flow vs Remote Table replication flow in Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi @kartheekkk ,  thanks for the great blog. One thing I want to add is with the real time replication using remote table, database triggers are created on the source table, and with replication flow, subscribers are created in sources. 

One drawback of the triggers is you have to remove them every time there is a transport of the table structure from lower systems. The table in the higher environment will be different ( if real time replication is active ) which will result in RC8 transport error.

entry.title: Re: Equipment Loan in SAP S4 Service
entry.content:
Hello @Rishabh20 

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition – Service, the Equipment Loaner process is much more restricted than in Private Edition because you don’t have full SPRO access. You set it up using SSCUI (Self-Service Configuration UIs) and delivered scope items.

Here’s the breakdown:

  1. Scope Items You Need

For loaner processes in Public Cloud, you normally rely on:

  • 3D2 – In-House Repair (covers sending a temporary replacement)
  • BJ2 – Service Order Management and Monitoring
  • 4HI – Corrective Maintenance (if tied to asset repair)

You must activate these to Manage Your Solution.

  1. Configuration in Public Cloud

Since SPRO isn’t available, use SSCUI to Configure Your Solution:

2.1 Service Order Types

  • SSCUI: Define Service Order Types 
  • Create/copy an order type for loaners, assign a status profile and an item category.

2.2 Item Category Determination

  • SSCUI: Define Item Categories in Service Orders 
  • Ensure your loaner item category is delivery relevant.

2.3 Serial Number Management

  • Activate Serial Number Profile for your loaner material, so the equipment can be tracked.

2.4 Equipment Master Data

  • Use the Manage Equipment app to create loaner equipment linked to your loaner material.
  1. Execution Steps in Public Cloud
  • Create Service Order
    • App: Manage Service Orders → use loaner order type.
    • Assign loaner material and equipment.
  • Outbound Delivery
    • Triggered from service order (Public Cloud uses integrated delivery creation via Release to Service Execution).
    • Post goods issue to move loaner to customer.
  • Track Loaner Equipment
    • App: Display Equipment → monitor current location.
  • Return Process
    • Create a return delivery in the system.
    • Post goods receipt to bring the loaner back into stock.
  • Close Service Order
    • Set to Completed status in Manage Service Orders.

With kind regards

Chuma Ofole

 

 

  • GenAI assistance content
  • SAP Documentation References
    • SAP Help Portal – Service Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • Learning More About the Solution Processes of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Service
    • SAP Learning Hub → Service Order Management in Public Cloud e-learning

entry.title: Re: Which API should be used to create an Invoice and als...
entry.content:
Hello!

If you need to create the invoice and make sure Trading Partner (VBUND) is filled, it depends on the invoice type:

FI invoice (FB70-type) → Use the Journal Entry – Post (Synchronous) API. You can pass VBUND directly in the line item, or let it derive from the business partner master data, as long as it’s maintained there and the document type is set up accordingly.

SD invoice (VF01) → Creation is only available via SOAP service (Billing Document – Create or Billing Document Request – Create). Once SD posts the FI document, VBUND will be derived from master data/config as usual. If you just need to read it, you can use the OData API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV.

Note: the Billing OData service is for read, cancel, and PDF only — it doesn’t create invoices.

entry.title: Re: Finding Odata Service(s) for a Fiori aap
entry.content:
Hello @Ashali 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the OData service for a Fiori app is only listed in the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library if it is a released service for external use. If the OData Service(s) field is blank, as in the case of Display Material Cost Estimates, it usually indicates below.

  • The app uses an analytical engine protocol or internal/private CDS views, not an exposed OData service.
  • The backend service exists but is not whitelisted for integration in the Public Cloud.

How can you check on your tenant?

  • Open the app → User Menu → About / App Information → check Technical Details for any OData service name.
  • Use the App Support app to see if any service or CDS view is linked.
  • In browser developer tools, look for metadata calls (for reference only, not supported for external use).

Official alternatives in Public Cloud,

  • Use released APIs from SAP API Business Hub, search for Product Costing or Cost Estimate APIs.
  • Use released analytical queries via View Browser, then expose them through the OData for Analytics endpoint.
  • Export data using the app’s built-in export functions.

In the Public Cloud, SAP recommends only using whitelisted APIs and released queries for integrations. Direct consumption of internal OData services is not supported.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, only released APIs and CDS views are supported for consumption in external integrations.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Maintenance Timelines for SAP ERP HCM: What You Need to Know
entry.content:
This blog aims to inform you about the SAP ERP 6.0 maintenance timelines which SAP announced in 2020 and how they apply to your SAP ERP HCM (Human Capital Management) solution. We'll guide you through identifying your release and enhancement package level and outline your options to remain within maintenance.

When Will Maintenance for SAP ERP HCM End?

As outlined in the SAP Release and Maintenance Strategy (login required) and detailed in SAP Note 2881788 (login required) and the Product Availability Matrix (PAM), mainstream maintenance for the latest three enhancement packages for SAP ERP 6.0 – specifically enhancement packages 6, 7, and 8 – runs until December 31, 2027. This is followed by an optional extended maintenance phase lasting until December 31, 2030, which carries an additional cost.

However, it is crucial to note that mainstream maintenance for SAP ERP HCM 6.0 without any enhancement package, as well as SAP ERP HCM 6.0 with enhancement packages 1 to 5, will conclude on December 31, 2025.

How to Find Your Release and Enhancement Package Level

To determine your system's release and enhancement package level, follow these steps:

1. Log on to your system and open the system status:

This can typically be accessed from the main menu or administration settings.

2. Open the product version details:

Look for detailed information about the installed software versions.

3. Locate the entry for SAP_HR and note the release number next to it:

For any SAP ERP 6.0 system, the first digit will be 6. The second digit is not relevant for this check, and the third digit indicates your enhancement package level. For instance, 604 means the system is on SAP ERP 6.0 with enhancement package 4.

What Are Your Options to Stay in Maintenance?

It is important to start planning now, especially if you are using a system with maintenance ending in 2025, as transition projects can take months or even years.

SAP S/4HANA: With SAP's maintenance commitment extending until 2040 and over 20,000 customers already on board, SAP S/4HANA is the natural destination for a short-term technical transition. Many organizations also opt to move to the cloud, choosing RISE with SAP. Reach out to your SAP account executive or SAP partner to explore your options, including opportunities to modernize and transform to SAP SuccessFactors.

SAP Readiness Check: Before making any moves, we strongly recommend starting with the SAP Readiness Check. These tools are included with your maintenance agreement at no extra cost, providing a comprehensive overview of the most important aspects for a transition to SAP S/4HANA. While primarily designed for customers considering a system conversion (a technical transition of an entire SAP ERP system to SAP S/4HANA), SAP Readiness Checks also offer valuable insights for those planning a new implementation.  There are two Readiness Check variants that will support HCM transition. 

First is the SAP Readiness Check for S/4HANA Conversion.  This Readiness Check will provide you with insight into the Simplification Items required for HCM.  Additionally, the SAP Readiness Check for SAP SuccessFactors will provide more extensive insight into which components of the HCM solution are deployed, to what extent it has been customized, and a summary of integrations.  If you are running S/4HANA and HCM in the same landscape, these two Readiness Checks can be run together, for a consolidated view. 

Call to Action

Don’t miss out on these critical steps to ensure your system remains supported:

  1. Review your system to determine product release and associated end of maintenance date per the process outlined above.
  2. Run the SAP Readiness Checks to understand the scope and requirements for your transition.
  3. Explore the HCM EvoKit by registering on the appropriate page.
  4. Share your thoughts and feedback in the comments section below.

By acting now, you can ensure a smooth transition and continued support for your SAP ERP HCM solution.

entry.title: Forms Service by Adobe (SAP Cloud Platform Enterprise) - Usage vs Billing
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

Writing this blog to get the user community opinion on SAP Cloud Platform Enterprise Agreement "Usage" and "Billing". If my concern is valid then please help raise it with your account executive to get the SAP billing process fixed.

As per my understanding this will only impact customers whose Cloud Agreement does not start at the beginning of the month.

My scenario - Enterprise Cloud Agreement Jan 12, XXXX - Jan 11, (XXXX + 1). And we only use "Forms Service by Adobe" and we have purchased enough credits to support 2M form requests per contract year.


Cost breakdown by month and contract year.

Contract Year

(CY) #

Year

Month

 Opening Balance 

 Monthly Cost 

Usage

Credit at end of the month/ contract 

Comment

CY 1

2024

December

 15,232.00

98.00

6.6K

15,134.00

 Starting the table in Dec 2024 as the issue occurs in Jan 2025.

CY 1

2024

January

15,134.00

5,726.03

1.7M

9,407.97

Usage is 1.7 M, but cost is 5,726 for the period. Usage is based on contract year. But cost is equally distributed over the whole month, which crosses two contract years. Due to which CY1 has less cost based on total number of days in the CY1 for that month. And because of that the credit of 9407.97 is lost.

CY 2

2025

January

 18,036.00

10,410.97

58.2K

7,625.03

Usage is 58.2K but cost is 10,410 for the period. It costs more for 58.2K because cost is equally distributed over the whole month, which crosses two contract years.  Jan 1 – 11 which are in contract year 1 had 1.7 M request that cost is getting incurred in CY2. And because of that CY2 credits are used for CY1 usage and CY1 credits are getting lost.

CY 2

2025

February

7,625.03

504.00

41.5K

7,121.03

 

 

In the table above Jan is the month where contract 1 ends on Jan 11 and contract 2 starts on Jan 12. On Jan 10, 2025, we did performance testing as we had faced few issues while deploying the Forms Service by Adobe. Even though the usage was in contract year 1 and contract year 1 had enough credit $ remaining the billing was spread across two contract years, and cost was equally distributed for the whole month without respecting that contract period and $ credits. Due to which we lost the contract year 1 credit of 9.4K and ended up using 10.4K from the current contract year 2 for the usage of contract year 1.

Based on the above it is obvious when the contract does not begin on the first of the month then SAP billing results in overcharging the customer for cloud usage for that specific month. This issue is only for those customers whose SAP Cloud Platform Enterprise Agreement does not start on the first day of the month and had a major spike at the end of the previous contract period.

What is so frustrating is that we requested credit for 9.4K and SAP’s response was that their billing system has no issues. We requested to change the contract from Jan 12 to Jan 1 that way it does not occur in future, but we are facing pushbacks on that change.

Question:

  1. Do you think the billing process needs to be reviewed that way customer does not lose credits and get charged for previous contract year in the next contract year?
  2. Is my request for the credit and change to contract date reasonable?

entry.title: Re: To integrate s4hana public cloud with sap PaPM system
entry.content:
Hello @897654208074 ,

For this integration, yes, you will need to follow the procedure below;

Communication User – For authentication.

  • Go to Communication Management → Communication Users in SAP S/4HANA, Public Cloud.
  • Create a new user and set the password (store it securely).

Communication System – To specify the technical identity of the external system.

  • Go to Communication Systems.
  • Create a system with a meaningful ID for example BTP_INTEGRATION_SYS and the hostname of your target BTP endpoint.
  • Assign the Communication User created in step 1.

Communication Arrangement – To activate the correct API/service scenario.

  • SAP_COM_0276 – Generic OData API integration
  • SAP_COM_0008 – Business Partner
  • SAP_COM_0109 – Sales Order
    (Refer to the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library to confirm the correct scenario for your case.)
  • Assign the Communication System and review the generated service URLs.

Destination in SAP BTP – To connect BTP to S/4HANA Cloud.

In the BTP Cockpit, create a new HTTP destination:

  • URL: Service URL from the Communication Arrangement
  • Proxy Type: Internet
  • Authentication: BasicAuthentication
  • User/Password: Communication User credentials

Optional: Add properties like sap-client or HTML5.DynamicDestination=true if needed for HTML5 apps.

Process overview:
1 → Create Communication User
2 → Create Communication System
3 → Create Communication Arrangement (matching the API)
4 → Create Destination in BTP (pointing to the service URL)

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: 🔴 Clean Core, Event-Driven: Unlocking SAP Value with Advanced Event Mesh
entry.content:
"Clean core is the foundation of modern SAP implementations—but achieving it while maintaining seamless integration across your enterprise landscape is one of the biggest challenges developers face today.

In this session, you’ll learn how SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) empowers developers to overcome these hurdles and unlock greater value from both SAP and non-SAP systems.

We’ll explore how to rethink business processes as events. You’ll see how AEM helps you liberate data from silos, stream it across systems, filter for what matters, and react in real time—while enabling secure, democratized access across your organization.

We’ll also introduce the concept of micro integrations—a practical architectural pattern that simplifies complex system interactions and promotes agility, all while supporting a cleaner core.

Through a hands-on demo, we’ll showcase multiple micro integration scenarios, including one using the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) plugin, illustrating how to build responsive, decoupled SAP solutions.

Whether you're extending SAP, integrating services, or driving agility with SAP BTP, this session will give you the tools and perspective to evolve your integration strategy—without compromising the core."

entry.title: Re: Public Cloud Payment medium file - Hash total calcula...
entry.content:
Hello @Sandhya_Reddy1 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the supplied Payment Medium Formats and the mapping logic in the Manage Payment Medium Formats app do not permit the direct embedding of multistep custom hash algorithms for .txt outputs, especially when they involve multi-field calculations like in your 3-step example.

You have a few possible approaches:

Pre/Post-Processing with Payment Medium Workbench (PMW)

  • If your format is PMW-based, you can use mapping logic extensions via Custom Fields and Logic (BAdI FINS_PMT_MEDIUM_MAP).
  • However, for .txt output, PMW still generates the file in the standard sequence, you need to include your calculated hash as part of a footer or trailer record.

SAP Help – configure Payment Medium Formats
SAP Help – BAdI for Payment Medium Mapping

Side-by-Side Calculation in BTP

  • Send the payment data to SAP Business Technology Platform via an API (API_PAYMENTADVICE_SRV or API_OUTBOUND_PAYMENTS_SRV), perform the hash total logic in a small Node.js/Java service, and output the .txt file in the exact format the bank needs.
  • This gives full control over calculations but keeps the Public Cloud core clean.


SAP API Business Hub – Outbound Payments API

Use Advanced Payment Management (if licensed)

  • If your landscape includes SAP Advanced Payment Management on BTP, you can establish file creation logic with custom calculations prior to generating the bank file.

In brief,

  • Public Cloud itself cannot incorporate this kind of multi-step hashing logic directly for .txt formats through standard configuration.
  • The most practical options are BAdI-based mapping logic in PMW or side-by-side processing in BTP.
  • The blog you found applies to .xml naming/hash rules and doesn’t cover .txt line-hash scenarios.

If you would like, I can prepare a BAdI sample implementation that performs your exact 3-step calculation so you can integrate it into the Payment Medium Mapping for .txt formats.

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Story Report with Direct Reports AND Salary with Acti...

entry.title: 🔴 Enterprise in Motion: Event-Driven Architecture Use Cases for Innovation and Agility
entry.content: Discover how event-driven architecture (EDA) can transform enterprises. This session starts with a quick introduction to EDA, presents real-world use cases, explores common patterns, and offers practical tips for identifying EDA opportunities. Developers will learn how to leverage EDA for greater flexibility, scalability, and responsiveness in their enterprise projects.

entry.title: 🔴 Warp-Speed for Event Creation: Overview on the new Event Add-on for ERP
entry.content: In this session, we will introduce the new SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh, event add-on for ERP. The overview will explain the value of the add-on when event-enabling SAP systems, when to use it, how to get started, and commercial aspects.

entry.title: Re: Where to download SAP GUI for MAC OS?

entry.title: Re: manage purchase order workflow in inapproval status
entry.content:
Hello @jerrysam 

The status displayed in the Manage Purchase Orders Fiori app is the definitive status for subsequent activities like Goods Receipt (GR).

If the PO still shows In Approval in this app, GR posting will be blocked even if other views appear to show released. This usually happens when the Flexible Workflow encounters an error or is interrupted during processing.

Steps to resolve it,

  • Open the Workflows in the Status Error app (requires the administrator role SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR or equivalent).
  • Locate the affected PO and select Resume After Error.
    • This continues the approval without restarting the workflow.
  • Check the Manage Purchase Orders app to confirm the status is now released.
  • Once the status is updated, you can post the GR.
  • If the status does not change or the PO does not appear in Workflows in Status Error, please raise an SAP support ticket under component MM-FIO-PUR-PO-WFL.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: 🔴 Hands-on session: practical demonstration of the Event Add-on for ERP
entry.content: In this session, we will demonstrate how to configure events in the Event Add-on for ERP and send them to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. You will learn how the add-on reacts to changes in the SAP system, turns them into events, and then seamlessly integrates with the broker, while benefiting from advanced features like Dynamic Topics and Async API specifications for Event Portal.

entry.title: 🔴 Seamless side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub
entry.content:
An example on how to realize SAP’s strategy for clean core through side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build.
This session will provide an overview of the relevant capabilities from SAP Build, north star architecture and do a deep dive into how it is realized using SAP Cloud Application Event Hub. SAP Build already leverages this integration into supporting seamless integration with SuccessFactors and S/4 HANA. The presenters will go through how the journey looks from an end user and from an application provider’s perspectives. Details such as overall architecture and technical prerequisites will also be covered, including combining all the relevant pieces into a “how-to” integrate guide.

entry.title: Re: SEN: Tags for email notifications to users
entry.content:
Hi Charlene,

There are two ways to send messages to Enable Now users.

1. In the Manager > Server Settings area there is a Notifications and Email section of settings that provides the ability to send message to content authors and administrators when specific activities are triggered, e.g. to send a message to an author to trigger an update to that object.  The Activation setting in this area can be used to send messages to new end users to inform them their manual user account has been created.  So, this option will not help with your requirement

2. The second option is to use the messaging system in Manager to send messages to end users - Administration > Messages.  In this case, it is possible to use this functionality to send formatted messages to end users.  There is no way to embed placeholders into the Body of the message, e.g. to insert content such as a Course Title, but the content in the message can be formatted using HTML tags. 
The To field of the message will allow you to target specific users for your message, typically using a User Role or Org Unit value.

This is definitely your best option to target Enable Now user groups with email messages.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Re: How to integrate SAP GRDC with Datasphere for public...
entry.content:
Hello @897654208074 

You can integrate SAP Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) with SAP Datasphere using the OData APIs that GRDC provides.

High-level steps below.

  • Find the right GRDC API in SAP API Business Hub (e.g., API_CNSLDTNGRPJRNLENTRT for consolidation journal entries).
  • Create a Communication User, System, and Arrangement in S/4HANA Cloud for that API (e.g., scenario SAP_COM_0524).
  • In SAP Datasphere, create a connection to S/4HANA Cloud using the API host and Basic Authentication from your Communication User.
  • Browse and import the OData entities into Datasphere as Remote Tables.
  • Model and consume the data for reporting.

Check below documentation

  • SAP Help – Connect SAP Datasphere to S/4HANA Cloud
  • Learning HUB
  • SAP Help – Group Reporting Data Collection Overview

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: 🔴 Using Intermediate Message Events and Success Factors Events in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Join us for an immersive session that explores the power of event-driven and API-based automation using SAP Build Process Automation. In today’s connected enterprise, automation needs to be responsive, scalable, and tightly integrated with core systems like S/4HANA and SuccessFactors. This session offers a deep dive into the key enablers that make that possible.

We’ll begin with an overview of API triggers, showcasing how external systems can initiate workflows through exposed APIs. Then, we’ll uncover the power of Intermediate Message Events (IMEs)—an essential tool for designing asynchronous, API-driven processes.

You'll also gain insights into setting up the Unified Connectivity Layer (UCL) and Event Broker, forming the backbone for scalable event handling in SAP Build.

Through live demos, you’ll witness two real-world scenarios:
🔹 Sales Order integration with S/4HANA, demonstrating how APIs and IMEs work together
🔹 SuccessFactors onboarding event trigger, where events initiate workflow via the Event Broker setup

Whether you're a developer, architect, or business process expert, this session will equip you with the knowledge to build intelligent, integrated, and event-aware automations.

entry.title: 🔴 A(P)I: Unified connectivity for AI applications using MCP
entry.content: This session will demonstrate how to connect AI-powered applications to external data sources, facilitating real-time AI-to-data integrations using a standardized mechanism based on the Model Context Protocol (MCP). We will explore key concepts of MCP, then put theory into practice with hands-on examples. Beyond exploring opportunities, applications and scenarios this technology enables, the session will also discuss typical operational challenges and security threats encountered when deploying and using MCP servers.
